ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my French in all aspects: reading, writing, listening, grammar, and vocabulary.
Reading and writing in French as well as conversing and deeply analysing french material,
Noticeably improved my French grammar and vocabulary.
I have learned so much in terms of conversational French.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course does a great job of keeping you engaged with a lot of assigned work, readings, and activities. It also assesses everything it teaches you, so you actually have to learn all the grammar and vocabulary content that you go over in class, which is very helpful at the end of the day.
Sometimes it was hard to keep up with the conversation in the classroom.
Very little opportunity to speak between peers

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course if you want to significantly improve your French and don't mind having going through a lot of work almost every day.
Yes if they have a light schedule
Yes if goal is to complete L5
I would only recommend this class if you're actually comfortable speaking in front of people. It's very fast paced conversation and it's not very conducive for you if you're a little timid.
